chinese: [C] any of the large systems of stars, etc. in outer space 星系
examples: e.g. Observations of distant [[galaxies]] indicate that they are moving away from us and the universe is expanding.

chinese: connected with the planet Earth 地球的；地球上的
examples: e.g. Technology gives us immense power over nature, and our decisions will affect all [[terrestrial]] life.

chinese: (fml.) make it necessary for you to do sth. 使成为必需；需要
examples: e.g. Sales have dropped dramatically, [[necessitating]] big cuts in production and employment.

chinese: relating to the watching of sb. / sth. in order to learn new things 观察的；观测的
examples: e.g. We film in an [[observational]] style, following events over a period of months to see how things turn out.

chinese: [C] one of the things from which sth. is made, esp. one of the foods that are used together to make a particular dish 成分；（尤指烹饪）原料
examples: e.g. Meals are prepared by the chef on board using fresh [[ingredients]] which are bought daily.

chinese: v.travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth or the Sun 沿轨道运行；环绕···运行
examples: e.g. The Earth is one of several planets that [[orbit]] the Sun, and the Moon [[orbits]] around the Earth.；e.g. These planets have circular (环形的) [[orbits]] similar to the [[orbits]] of planets in our solar system.

chinese: n.[C] the curved path traveled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth or the Sun （环绕地球、太阳等运行的）轨道
examples: e.g. The Earth is one of several planets that [[orbit]] the Sun, and the Moon [[orbits]] around the Earth.；e.g. These planets have circular (环形的) [[orbits]] similar to the [[orbits]] of planets in our solar system.

chinese: 1) [C]（太阳等恒星的）耀斑
examples: e.g. A sudden [[flare]] of light caused her to raise her right arm protectively across her face.

chinese: 2) [C, usu. sing.] a bright but unsteady light or flame that does not last long （短暂的）旺火；（摇曳的）光；（闪耀的）火光
examples: e.g. A sudden [[flare]] of light caused her to raise her right arm protectively across her face.

chinese: vt.remove sth. that is covering the surface of sth. else 剥去，除去（表面的东西）
examples: e.g. I think we should [[strip]] the old paint off and see what the wood is like underneath.；e.g. The islands are separated by a narrow [[strip]] of water.

chinese: n.a long narrow area of land, sea, etc. （陆地、海域等）狭长地带；带状水域
examples: e.g. I think we should [[strip]] the old paint off and see what the wood is like underneath.；e.g. The islands are separated by a narrow [[strip]] of water.

chinese: [C] (pl. axes) the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns （旋转）轴；轴线
examples: e.g. The Earth and many other planets in the solar system rotate on their [[axes]] and revolve around the Sun.

chinese: (BrE stabilise) become or make sth. become firm, steady and unlikely to change （使）稳定，稳固
examples: e.g. He suffered a second heart attack two days ago but his condition has now [[stabilized]].

chinese: of or related to an axis 轴的；轴线的
examples: e.g. The Moon's presence also slows the [[axial]] rotation of the Earth, which is why we could have 24-hour days.

chinese: [C, U] a position in which one end or side of sth. is higher than the other; an act of tilting sth. to one side 倾斜；倾侧
examples: e.g. Since childhood, we have been learning the languages of the eyes, the hands and those subtle [[tilts]] of the head.

chinese: vt.protect sb. / sth. from being harmed or damaged 保护；保卫
examples: e.g. He wrapped himself in his heavy coat and sat in the corner where the bamboo leaves [[shielded]] him from the wind.

chinese: n.[C] 盾；盾牌
examples: e.g. He wrapped himself in his heavy coat and sat in the corner where the bamboo leaves [[shielded]] him from the wind.

chinese: causing a lot of destruction, suffering, or death 灾难性的；毁灭性的
examples: e.g. The movie shows heroes risking their lives to save the Earth from a [[catastrophic]] collision with a comet (彗星).

chinese: used when you describe sth. using part of a well-known expression 俗话说的；常言道
examples: e.g. There are some observers who make predictions all the time about economic recessions, the collapse of civil society, and the [[proverbial]] "end of the world."

chinese: [C] a planet that is not in the solar system 系外行星
examples: e.g. Astronomers say that this unique observing technique opens a new phase in the exploration of [[exo-planets]].

chinese: [U] the branch of biology that investigates the possibility of life elsewhere in the universe 天体生物学
[C] a belief or opinion that you have already formed before you know the actual facts, and that may be wrong 事先形成的看法（想法）；先入之见；成见
examples: e.g. Try to go into the meeting without too many [[preconceptions]] about what the other group wants.

chinese: of or relating to the action of water under conditions of high temperature, esp. in forming rocks and minerals 热液的
[C] an opening that allows air, gas or liquid to pass out of or into a room, building, container, etc. （空气、气体、液体的）出口，进口，漏孔
examples: e.g. Make sure that jars have tight lids and are kept away from sunlight and heating [[vents]].

chinese: 1) [U] the fact of sb. / sth. not existing or not being available; a lack of sth. 不存在；缺乏
examples: e.g. The case was dismissed in the [[absence]] of any definite proof.；e.g. The smell of cigarette smoke confirmed what he had suspected: There had been a party in his [[absence]].

chinese: 2) [C, U] when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away 不在；缺席
examples: e.g. The case was dismissed in the [[absence]] of any definite proof.；e.g. The smell of cigarette smoke confirmed what he had suspected: There had been a party in his [[absence]].

chinese: reasonable and likely to be true or successful 貌似有理的；似乎是真的
examples: e.g. A more [[plausible]] explanation would seem to be that people are fed up with their routine life.

chinese: (~ to sth.) making it easy, possible or likely for sth. to happen 有助于···的发生
examples: e.g. Our ultimate goal is to create a culture that is [[conducive]] to continual progress and learning.

chinese: [C, usu. pl.]1) sth. that you must have in order to do sth. else 必要条件；必备的条件
examples: e.g. Success in the examination did not secure by itself a postgraduate position, but it was the minimum [[requirement]].；e.g. The average daily food [[requirement]] is about 2,000 calories for women and 2,500 for men.

chinese: 2) sth. that you need or want 所需的（或所要的）东西
examples: e.g. Success in the examination did not secure by itself a postgraduate position, but it was the minimum [[requirement]].；e.g. The average daily food [[requirement]] is about 2,000 calories for women and 2,500 for men.

chinese: [C, U] a very thin piece of skin that covers or connects parts of your body （覆盖或连接身体某些部分的）膜；薄膜
examples: e.g. Exposure to loud noise from fireworks can damage the delicate [[membrane]] in the ear.

chinese: containing water or similar to water 含水的；似水的
examples: e.g. In chemistry, an [[aqueous]] solution or cream has water as its base.

chinese: [C] 放射性同位素
1) the process by which a radioactive substance changes to a different form, producing radiation （放射性物质的）衰变
examples: e.g. The study did not find any association between secondhand smoke exposure and [[decay]] in permanent teeth.

chinese: 2) the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of sth. 腐烂；朽烂
examples: e.g. The study did not find any association between secondhand smoke exposure and [[decay]] in permanent teeth.

chinese: relating to or coming from the heat inside the Earth 地热的；地温的
examples: e.g. The ice sheet acts like a huge blanket that locks in the [[geothermal]] heat that comes naturally from the Earth.

chinese: (only before noun) (of an animal) living apart from the main group, and possibly dangerous 离群的
examples: e.g. It's reported that [[rogue]] elephants have killed at least 31 people in that area this year.

chinese: suitable for people to live in 适合居住的
examples: e.g. We are constantly looking for new [[habitable]] areas.

chinese: (esp. AmE) (also enquire esp. BrE) ask sb. for some information 询问；打听
examples: e.g. I called the school to [[inquire]] about the application process.

chinese: (esp. AmE) (also enquiry esp. BrE)1) [U] the act of asking questions or collecting information about sb. / sth. 查询；探究；探索
examples: e.g. On further [[inquiry]], it emerged that Malcolm had not been involved in the incident.；e.g. An [[inquiry]] will be held to discover why the local school's educational record is so bad.

chinese: 2) [C] an official process to find out the cause of sth. or to find out information about sth. 调查；查究；查问
examples: e.g. On further [[inquiry]], it emerged that Malcolm had not been involved in the incident.；e.g. An [[inquiry]] will be held to discover why the local school's educational record is so bad.

chinese: (only before noun) relating to a planet or planets 行星的
examples: e.g. This means a huge step forward in understanding how [[planetary]] systems form and evolve.

chinese: [U] 光谱术；光谱学
ask questions in order to find out secret or hidden information about sb. / sth. 盘问；追问；探究
examples: e.g. We have been [[probing]] the reasons why the government has been so slow to react to the problem of climate change.

chinese: (usu. before noun) happening, expected, or needed during a particular season 季节性的；时令的；当令的
examples: e.g. One major factor causing [[seasonal]] variations in food supplies was the difficulty of storage.

chinese: (also periodical) (only before noun) happening a number of times, usu. at regular times 周期（性）的；定期的
examples: e.g. Do a [[periodic]] review of your lecture notes and the relevant chapters in your textbooks.

chinese: [C] 中微子
[C] a person or animal that lives in a particular place 居民；栖居的动物
examples: e.g. According to the report, the city's first [[inhabitants]] arrived in the 16th century.

chinese: [U] the fact or process of noticing or discovering sth. 觉察；发现；侦察；探测
examples: e.g. There should be a more effective treatment for patients identified through early [[detection]].

chinese: 1) [C, usu. pl.] a quality or power that a substance, plant, etc. has 特性；性质；属性
examples: e.g. For practical purposes the solar spectrum (光谱) is divided into regions with characteristic [[properties]].；e.g. Please take care of your own belongings. The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests' personal [[property]].

chinese: 2) [U] the thing or things that sb. owns 所有物；资产；财产
examples: e.g. For practical purposes the solar spectrum (光谱) is divided into regions with characteristic [[properties]].；e.g. Please take care of your own belongings. The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests' personal [[property]].

chinese: 1) (~ yourself / sb. to sth. / to doing sth.) allow yourself or sb. to have only a limited amount of sth. or to do only a particular kind of activity 约束；限制
examples: e.g. The senator said he would voluntarily [[restrict]] himself to $2.2 million in campaign spending.；e.g. Because of limited space, the number of people who can attend the ceremony is [[restricted]] to 35.

chinese: 2) limit the size, amount or range of sth. 限制，限定 （大小、数量、范围等）
examples: e.g. The senator said he would voluntarily [[restrict]] himself to $2.2 million in campaign spending.；e.g. Because of limited space, the number of people who can attend the ceremony is [[restricted]] to 35.

chinese: (only before noun) of or connected with the Sun 太阳的
examples: e.g. An increase in the number of dark spots on the Sun marks a period of high [[solar]] activity.

chinese: (usu. passive) make sb. / sth. certain to fail, die, be destroyed, etc. 使注定（失败、死亡、毁灭等）
examples: e.g. A rare star system has been found in our Milky Way galaxy, but it is [[doomed]] to end in a massive explosion.

chinese: relating to things that exist outside the Earth 地球外的；宇宙的；外星的
examples: e.g. Over the years, we've been conditioned to accept the possibility of [[extraterrestrial]] life through movies and reports about alien encounters.

chinese: 木星（太阳系中最大的行星）
